channel.title: mySQL DB Checker
channel.description:
Hey this is really basic i just thought i would share with the community.
What it does is it connects to a MySQL Database and returns if it has a good/stable connection or... if it cannot connect and then tells you the error.
Please try make it better if you wish or do what you want with it, have fun but if you do download it cauld you leave feedback please?

item.title: mySQL DB Checker
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:6, topic:116673”][quote author=Fasga link=topic=165948.msg1546396#msg1546396 date=1182894617]

Can Java connect to SQL Databases over the internet, or does it have to be a local database?

Both.
[/quote]

Ah cool. <3[/quote]
I made a small java app to connect to internet one. Just had to modify my actual mySQL user settings to allow it to get connections from remote IPs

This is mine, yes i suck at java

    import java.sql.*;

    class test {
        public static void main(String[] args) {
        Connection con = null;   

        try {
            Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver").newInstance();
        } catch (Exception ex) {
            System.out.println ("unable to load driver");
        }

        try
        {
            String url = "jdbc:mysql://[IP]/[DB]";
            con = DriverManager.getConnection(url, "[User]", "[Pass]");

            if (!con.isClosed())
                System.out.println("Successfully connected to MySQL server...");

            Statement stmt = con.createStatement();
//testing retrieving table's fields
            ResultSet rs = stmt.executeQuery ("SELECT name,ip,port FROM ratings");

            while (rs.next())
            {
                String n = rs.getString("name");
                String i = rs.getString("ip");
                String p = rs.getString("port");
                System.out.println(n + " " + i + ":" + p);
            }

        }
        catch (SQLException E)
        {
            System.err.println("SQLException: " + E.getMessage());
            System.err.println("SQLState: " + E.getSQLState());
            System.err.println("VendorError: " + E.getErrorCode());
        }

        }
    }

Read full topic

item.title: mySQL DB Checker
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Not bad, assuming you are new.
Just not sure that the class ‘dbInfo’ is really necessary. There’s no point making a class that only has a few static fields in it - rather, just put them in the main class, or have the values read from file.
Making the user edit java source code is generally a ‘no-no’

Read full topic
